I disagree with the irrational "nuke ownership" interpretation. I have always argued for an individual RKBA interpretation of the 2nd. Amendment. Yet I have never made the absurd argument that it cannot be limited and that I should be permitted to own a nuke. This has been a favorite sham argument marketed by gun control supporters for years. The argument suggests that since the Amendment contains no limitation we cannot dare interpret it to be an individual right. The result would be the horror of "rednecks with nukes," they say. The illogic is obvious when you attempt to apply it to other unqualified rights.
 
 For example, if we accept that the equally unqualified 1st. Amendment protects an individual right to free exercise of religion, then must we also be prepared to accept the currently forbdden practice of appeasing the gods with human sacrifice? Absolutely not. 
 
 Although unqualified, each of these rights is subject to rational limitation. The real question is where to strike the balance.
